    Team News

    Barcelona
    • Luis Enrique has been experimenting with a back three recently and the Barcelona head coach could turn to this formation against Paris Saint-Germain in an attempt to overturn the 4-0 deficit from the first leg.
    • Sergio Busquets is one booking away from suspension in UEFA competition.
    Paris Saint-Germain
    • Unai Emery has named a full squad for the trip to Barcelona but he still has some injury concerns ahead of the match.
    • Angel Di Maria was not risked at the weekend but should be fit enough to start on Wednesday, while Adrien Rabiot should recover from illness to start in midfield.
    • Thiago Silva missed the first leg through injury and could replace Presnel Kimpembe at the heart of the defence, although the youngster was immense in the first leg.
    • Marquinhos and Rabiot are a booking away from a ban.

    Prediction

    • Barcelona will need to become only the fourth side to overturn 4-0 deficit in UEFA competition history and the first side to accomplish the feat since 1984/85. Luis Enrique's side should be encouraged after putting six goals past Sporting Gijon followed up by one of their best performances of the season at the weekend when they beat Celta Vigo 5-0.
    • The La Liga giants are seeking a 15th straight home victory in the Champions League, having won all 14 games at the Camp Nou under their current coach. They are unbeaten in 19 matches at home in the competition, a run that started in September 2013 (W18 D1). They have also won seven of the 10 matches they have hosted against French sides at the Camp Nou.
    • While you can see Barcelona scoring four, it's hard to see them keeping a clean sheet against PSG. Their failure to get an away goal in the first leg could prove their undoing on Wednesday.
    Prediction:
    Barcelona

      On Squawka, a referee was asked about the second penalty awarded to Suarez and he agreed with many comments below that it was probably not a penalty. However, all the people mad at the penalty are ignoring how many times PSG players took dives to have play pulled back when Barca were through on goal. At least twice in the second half. It's easy to see "cheating" by a team you dislike. Harder to see it from an unbiased perspective. Also, there's an awful lot of people pretending like their team doesn't have players who dive, or that diving is unusual or new to the game. Diving has ALWAYS been a part of the game. Ronaldinho, Ronaldo (both of 'em!), Drogba, Gerrard...all of these legends have dived. I'm a Messi fan and he has some HILARIOUS dives. Is it wrong for the player to dive? Not really. Is it right to blame the referee for being fooled? Nope. Worse for refs to ignore potentially dangerous fouls.

    • [ - ] SteveHyland - member since 03-Nov-12

      @delllello- The rule itself is badly written, I can't post a link but check out the FIFA site. Handball has to be intentional but there is a grey area surrounding contact fouls. The word reckless is used but that can relate to intentional or unintentional actions therefore being down to the opinion of the ref. Rules shouldn't be opinion-based, they should be fact-based. If the rule was re-written as "intentional.... (insert action by player)" then it would be black and white. There would still be mistakes, like many unintentional hand-balls are given as penalties but the first penalty last night was a 50-50 decision and the 2nd maybe a 25-75 decision. Both were given but my guess is neither would've been given if it were played in Paris.
